event: Earliest known human presence in Patagonia
Spanish explorer Juan Díaz de Solís explores the Río de la Plata
First founding of Buenos Aires by Pedro de Mendoza
Second and permanent founding of Buenos Aires by Juan de Garay
Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata established by Spain with Buenos Aires as capital
British invasions of the Río de la Plata repelled by local militias
May Revolution in Buenos Aires; start of independence movement
Declaration of Independence at Congress of Tucumán
San Martín crosses Andes and defeats Spanish forces in Chile
Period of anarchy; provinces struggle without central government
Juan Manuel de Rosas rises to power in Buenos Aires
Adoption of Argentine Constitution (except by Buenos Aires)
Unification of Argentina under President Bartolomé Mitre
Argentina enters War of the Triple Alliance against Paraguay
Federalization of Buenos Aires ends internal conflict
Beginning of mass European immigration and economic growth
Sáenz Peña Law introduces universal, secret male suffrage
Hipólito Yrigoyen becomes first president elected under new law
First military coup overthrows Yrigoyen; start of 'Infamous Decade'
Juan Domingo Perón elected president; start of Peronist era
Death of Eva Perón, popular First Lady
Military coup removes Perón; Peronist Party banned
Perón returns from exile and is re-elected president
Death of Juan Perón; succeeded by wife Isabel Perón
Military coup overthrows Isabel Perón; start of Dirty War
Argentina invades Falkland Islands; defeated by British forces
Return to democracy with election of Raúl Alfonsín
Carlos Menem elected president; neoliberal reforms begin
Economic collapse; multiple presidents in rapid succession
Néstor Kirchner elected president; begins economic recovery
Cristina Fernández de Kirchner elected president
Mauricio Macri elected president; shift to center-right policies
Alberto Fernández elected president with Cristina as VP
Javier Milei elected president amid economic crisis
